Notes:
- Spell Focuses in Abjuration allow you to dispel easier, and to be harder to be dispelled
- Spell focuses in illusion were taken rather than necromancy, because epic spell focus illusion grants you the epic spell Send_Image. Epic spell focus provides you a dracolich when using Epic Spell: Dragonknight. But, the dracolich isn't exactly powerful.
- Rogue levels give you reflex saves for many spells. Your DEX makes your save pretty decent. Then add +8 from Protection from Spells, and +6 from spellcraft. Those flame arrows aren't touching you.
- HP Looks low. From gear you can get +8 CON/INT, and then just buff the two stats. Giving you 24 CON/42 INT.
- Use Magic Device.. Mass heal scrolls! Party saver!
- Summons are all 1 spell level higher, due to spell focus conjuration
- With listen your range of hearing whispers are increased on arelith
- With spot you can see through disguises fairly good on arelith
-  +8 from Protection from Spells [moved from intrinsic saves]

Advantages
- High spell DCs
- Good at dispelling
- Hard to be dispelled.
- Skillpoints festival
- Easy coins with appraise
- Easier Leveling (Summons)
- Can bluff to avoid exile
- Send_Image, Ward Teleport/Scry, and Summon Player spells are available to this build.

Disadvantages
-Lowish HP
- AC is low
- Saves are fairly low against things other than spells

The point of this build was to get highest DCs possible on a wizard, while still being able to handle itself in PvP, and PvM.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I guess you meant that second Spell Focus in Conjuration to be Greater Spell Focus.

There will be those who will scold you for "wasting' skill points on Appraise and Lore and Bluff. To be more powerful in PvP, think about Hide, Move Silently and Set Trap instead. To fit my personal style, I'd replace 2 of those with Open Lock and Disable Trap, and keep the third (probably Lore).

Spellcraft gives you another +1 to saves against spells for every 5 points of modified score, so you are "wasting" 3 points there, too, unless you are anticipating boosting Spellcraft or INT to get Spellcraft to another multiple of 5.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
At level 24 a caster cannot be dispelled by any form except a Mord which will dispel/breach this guy pretty easily. Unless the Abj focus boost is really that effective, I'd stick with necromancy.

Recommend either swap Empowered for Maximize or make room for it somewhere. If you really are aiming for the the highest DCs, judging from all the spell foci in the list, Empowered will provide you a universal +1DC, unless you feel you can easily reach the +12 ability cap by other means. My theory has always been: Why rely on items to achieve a goal if your spells can accomplish it?... as is reflected in all my builds. I use the item enhancements to bolster weakness rather than to achieve a proficiency.

Also, I'd swap that Greater Ruin for Epic Warding in a heartbeat. Your Iron Golem or Red Dragon shapechange, buffed with the 3 recipro shields, Emp Bull's and mantle, will pierce DR up to +20 and be somewhat difficult to control in PvP. And btw, you can wait until after shifted to use the epic spell.

The spell focuses in Abjuration are very impacting, too. Probably the reason why almost every caster takes it!

I did mean that second spell focus to be greater spell focus. I didn't take disable trap, or open lock because you can easily get a fey familiar for that. With 'Find Trap' spell, you can reveal the trap and have a fey familiar get rid of it. Which is usually the route I go. With appraise, you easily make 75k gold/hour on arelith, which is why I took it. Capped out at 20, so I only put 20 points in. Bluff allows you to get into towns that you are banned from, so I thought that'd be worthwhile. And, finally, Lore allows you to understand every other language that is spoken IG. Else, you'd have to spend 6+ Real Life months learning the language, but with high lore you roll Vs DC 46 or so to understand it.

Sorry about necroing the post, but I have always had a doubt about these Rogue/Wizard builds; maybe somebody can shed some light:
Why don't take the first level as a Rogue? You benefit from a lot more of skills than if you take it as a Wizard.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Raist_BlackRobe wrote: Sorry about necroing the post, but I have always had a doubt about these Rogue/Wizard builds; maybe somebody can shed some light:
Why don't take the first level as a Rogue? You benefit from a lot more of skills than if you take it as a Wizard.
True, you can do that and get more skill points.The down side is that your spellpower will come later and not be up to the challenge you can expect from the spawns as you level up. Beware that on Arelith you will have to take the 3 first levels as rogue if you start with rogue, before you can choose your second class.
